Sentencas: The slow kinetics of the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) is one of the key challenges in developing high performance energy devices, such as solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: Straining a film by growing on a lattice-mismatched substrate has been a conventional approach to enhance the ORR activity.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: However, due to the limited choice of electrolyte substrates to alter the degree of strain, a systematic study in various materials has been a challenge.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: Here, we explore the strain modulation of the ORB.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: kinetics by growing epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta (LSCO) films on yttria-stabilized zirconia substrates with the film thickness below and above the critical thickness for strain relaxation.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: Two orders of magnitude higher ORB.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: kinetics is achieved in an ultrathin film with similar to 0.8% tensile strain as compared to unstrained films.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: Time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectrometry depth profiling confirms that the Sr surface segregation is not responsible for the enhanced ORR in strained films.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: We attribute this enhancement of ORR kinetics to the increase in oxygen vacancy concentration in the tensile-strained LSCO film owing to the reduced activation barrier for oxygen surface exchange kinetics.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction

Sentencas: Density functional theory calculations reveal an upshift of the oxygen 2p-band center relative to the Fermi level by tensile strain, indicating the origin of the enhanced ORR kinetics.
Titulo: Stretching Epitaxial La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ for Fast Oxygen Reduction
